entry.title: Maintain Octopress blog
entry.content:
This notes is about how to maintain Octopress blog in Github. <!—more—> 1. Clone your blog from Github

<pre><code>git clone git@github.com:clonehulk/clonehulk.github.com.git</code></pre>

  1. Checkout the source branch: 

    git checkout source

  2. Set the relationship between your local folder and Github pages: 

    rake setup_github_pages
    And follow the message to enter some information.

  3. Update your latest blog source code: 

    git pull origin source  # update the local source branch

  4. Write new blogs: 

    rake new_post[“title”]
rake generate
rake preview

  5. Commit to Github: 

    rake deploy
git add .
git commit -am ‘comment’
git push origin source

Want to config your Octopress? Try this:Configuring Octopress.

entry.title: Ruby on Mac
entry.content:
The default version of Ruby on Mac OXS is 1.8.7. But the Ruby Rails needs Ruby 1.9.3 or further. So we need update it.

Here is the notes about updating Ruby on Mac. <!—more—> 1. Installing RVM(Ruby Version Manager) for upgrading Ruby on OXS:

<pre><code>\curl -L get.rvm.io | bash -s stable</code></pre>
  1. Using this command to show all the available versions of Ruby. 
    rvm list known
  2. Installing one particular version, for example: 
    rvm install ruby 1.9.3
  3. Or if you just want the latest (current) version: 
    rvm install current && rvm use current

Please note that don’t uninstall the default version of Ruby on Mac.
